wiki.content:
From Chaos is the sixth studio album by 311, released on June 19, 2001.
 
 In 2000, before this album was recorded and released they left Capricorn Records and switched to Volcano Entertainment as their permanent label.
 
 Singles from this album include "You Wouldn't Believe", "Amber", and "I'll Be Here Awhile".
 
 From Chaos is the first album to ever be recorded in 311's current recording studio The Hive in North Hollywood, California.
 
 "From Chaos" is an "Enchanced CD," featuring interviews with the band.
 
 "Bomb the Town," "Will the World," "We Do It Like This," and "Dreamland" are b-sides from this CD. They can be heard on the bonus disc included with Enlarged to Show Detail 2.
 
 
  Track listing
 "You Get Worked" (Music: Hexum/Sexton; Lyrics: Hexum/Martinez) - 2:51 
 "Sick Tight" (Hexum; Hexum/Martinez) - 2:44 
 "You Wouldn't Believe"(Hexum; Hexum/Martinez) - 3:40 
 "Full Ride" (Sexton; Hexum/Martinez) - 3:07 
 "From Chaos" (Hexum; Hexum/Martinez) - 3:15 
 "I Told Myself" (Sexton/Hexum; Hexum/Martinez) - 4:10 
 "Champagne" (Hexum/Mahoney; Hexum/Martinez) - 3:04 
 "Hostile Apostle" (Hexum; Hexum/Martinez) - 3:44 
 "Wake Your Mind Up" (Sexton/Wills; Hexum/Will Adams/Tre Hardson) - 3:12 
 "Amber" (Hexum) - 3:29 
 "Uncalm" (Hexum/Mahoney; Hexum/Martinez) - 3:11 
 "I'll Be Here Awhile" (Hexum/Martinez) - 3:28 
 
 
 
 
  B-Sides & Outtakes
 "Bomb the Town" (Hexum/Martinez) - 3:32 - 2:51 (Appears on the Enlarged to Show Detail 2 bonus EP) 
 "Dreamland" - 1:14 - 2:51 (Appears on the Enlarged to Show Detail 2 bonus EP) 
 "We Do It Like This" (Hexum/Martinez) - 2:46 - 2:51 (Appears on the Enlarged to Show Detail 2 bonus EP and available via 311' website) [1]) 
 "Will the World" - 1:05 - 2:51 (Appears on the Enlarged to Show Detail 2 bonus EP) 
 "are you ready?" (intro at concerts)
 
 
  Demos
 "Slappy" - Early demo for Wake Your Mind Up 
 
 Charts
 Album
 
 Year Chart Position 
 2001 The Billboard 200 10 
 
 Singles
 
 Year Single Chart Position 
 2001 "You Wouldn't Believe" Modern Rock Tracks 7 
 2001 "You Wouldn't Believe" Mainstream Rock Tracks 32 
 2001 "I'll Be Here Awhile" Modern Rock Tracks 15 
 2002 "Amber" Modern Rock Tracks 13 
 
 
 Miscellanea
  Lists of miscellaneous information should be avoided. Please relocate any relevant information into appropriate sections or articles. (January 2009) 
 
 "Wake Your Mind Up" was written in collaboration with Will.i.am of Black Eyed Peas and Tre Hardson of The Pharcyde. 
 The Chinese characters in the liner notes of the album represent Energy, Clarity, Harmony, Courage, Wisdom and Enlightenment. 
 Nick Hexum wrote the lyrics for "I'll Be Here Awhile" at age 20. 
 The lyric "And if a person, place or thing can deliver/I will quiver with delight" in "I'll Be Here Awhile" was earlier used in the The 77s 1987 song "The Lust, The Flesh, The Eyes and the Pride of Life." 
 Hexum wrote "Amber" about his then-fiancee Nicole Scherzinger lead singer of The Pussycat Dolls.

In 2000, before this album was recorded and released they left Capricorn Records and switched to Volcano Entertainment as their permanent label.  Singles from this album include "You Wouldn't Believe", "Amber", and "I'll Be Here Awhile".  From Chaos is the first album to ever be recorded in 311's current recording studio The Hive in North Hollywood, California.
